abstract: Federal indictment of Suffolk County Police Chief James Burke accuses him of violating civil rights of thief who stole bag from Burke's car in 2012, and of trying to cover up violation by persuading his officers to lie about episode; case comes even as broader federal investigation is under way regarding county's political machines and its influence on local criminal justice system; investigators believe Burke and county Dist Atty Thomas J Spota used their offices to consolidate their power.

headline.main: Ex-Suffolk County Police Chief’s Arrest Comes Amid a Broader Federal Inquiry

snippet: The case against James Burke, who is accused of beating a suspected thief and trying to cover it up, suggests investigators are examining a political machine’s hold over the local criminal justice system.
